Discover Ethereum

Ethereum will solve real world problems, there are lots of use-cases where data shouldn't be altered once it enters an information system; financial applications, fingerprint/ identity applications, law applications & timestamping, public registers, crypto-currency and so on.


Ethereum is revolutionary because it allows developers to make contracts in any programming language on top of the blockchain. As it's completely open, developers love it.

Why we think Ethereum has a bright future

Having worked in corporate and government environments (and investing in bitcoin in 2011) we already early started to realise bitcoin might not be the only coin or blockchain that would be succesful, as there are many use-cases for which bitcoin isn't the perfect solution.

Instead of having a list of 500-1000 crypto currencies, all serving specific use cases and offering features aimed at specific markets, we see a lot of potential in Vitalik Buterin's vision to create an open development platform on top of a blockchain, this has limitless possibilities and virtually anything that you could imagine could be programmed on top of the Ethereum blockchain, using smart contracts.

Example prototype applications that are built on top of the Ethereum blockchain are already emerging and are really impressive, such examples are slock.it (a smart contract software lock) and augur (a decentralized prediction network).

There is also a large corporate interest in building applications that need stored data to be immutable and for example interest in building electricity micro grids using ethereum. In addition to that R3CEV, a banking consortium, announced the first trials with Ethereum.

From an investor perspective Ethereum is also interesting (and extremely risky similar to bitcoin), Ether is a tradeable asset and can be bought on exchanges like Kraken and Poloniex. At this point, there has been only one release and there are not that many exchanges (with high volume) who sell Ether. Especially Chinese exchanges seem to have not discovered Ether yet.

There will be 3 more releases until the product is finished, in the mean time Augur and Slock.it are expected to launch their initial release much earlier.

Corporate, governments & banks are looking at Ethereum with great interest and by the time everyone will have chosen Ethereum as their preferred stack, the investment is probably a lot less interesting.

Therefore, the best time to get in is: 'before it's too late'.
